metadata.title: Supplemental materials to "Cloud sync in response to wave-like large-scale forcings"
metadata.description:
This dataset deposits the supplemental materials for the manuscript "Cloud sync in response to wave-like large-scale forcings".

math_note.pdf  A hand-written math derivation note for equations in the appendices. 

movie_wL_006_T24hours.avi  A movie of near-surface (z=25m) water vapor mixing ratio for the wL=0.006m/s and T=24 hours experiment (the reference CM1 simulation).

movie_wL_006_T18hours.avi  A movie of near-surface (z=25m) water vapor mixing ratio for the wL=0.006m/s and T=18 hours experiment.

movie_wL_006_T12hours.avi  A movie of near-surface (z=25m) water vapor mixing ratio for the wL=0.006m/s and T=12 hours experiment.

movie_wL_000.avi  A movie of near-surface (z=25m) water vapor mixing ratio, without large-scale wave-like forcing.

input_sounding  The initial sounding for all CM1 simulations. 

namelist.input  The namelist file for launching all CM1 simulations. 

postprocessing_CM1.zip The postprocessing code of the CM1 simulations, including intermediate output files (.mat) in data postprocessing.  

microscopic_model.zip  The MATLAB code for the microscopic model. 

cm1.F  The CM1 script where the large-scale vertical velocity is programmed. You can copy it directly to your CM1/src/ path. 

 

Feel free to send an email to Dr. Hao Fu (haofu736@gmail.com) if you have any questions!

data.title: Supplemental materials to "Cloud sync in response to wave-like large-scale forcings"

metadata.title: The Hypothesis of Radioactive Equilibrium Point
metadata.description:
This is a preprint and must be reviewed, corrected, and
developed further after the revision, correction, and develop-
ment of Kemet Gravity Theory, Kemet Unified Fields The-
ory, and The Mutant Theory.
This paper proposes the Hypothesis of the Radioactive Equi-
librium Point, suggesting that the interaction between gamma ra-
diation and radio waves, applied in a specific intensity and frequency
ratio, can stabilize the radioactivity of any material. This hypothe-
sis is grounded in quantum field theory, nuclear physics, and
electromagnetic wave interactions, proposing that radiation can
be modulated to shift unstable isotopes toward a metastable or stable
state.
Mathematically, we explore wave-function symmetry, nuclear
decay equations, and resonant energy absorption. Chemically,
we analyze how electromagnetic waves interact with atomic
nuclei, potentially affecting radioactive decay rates. Biologically, we
consider the implications for radiation damage mitigation.

data.title: The Hypothesis of Radioactive Equilibrium Point

metadata.title: Galactic-Code-Developers/hinfty20-zeta-spectrum:  Riemann Zeta Function Analysis
metadata.description:
This simulation supports the theoretical framework presented in the paper:

Spectral Realization of the Nontrivial Zeros of the Riemann Zeta Function via a Hermitian Operator Framework

It approximates the operator spectrum using components derived from:

Discrete Geometric Quantum Gravity (DGQG) Multifaceted Coherence (MC) Infinity Algebra

creators.name: Adamopoulos, Ioannis
creators.affiliation: Hellenic Republic, Region of Attica, Department of Environmental Hygiene and Sanitarian Public Health Inspections, South Sector of Athens, Greece.

metadata.title: Toward a Unified Cosmological Framework
metadata.description: Propose an effective cosmological framework that integrates quantum geometric corrections, thermodynamic damping, and a dynamic sliding term into the Friedmann–Lemaître–Robertson–Walker (FLRW) equations. This model preserves compatibility with general relativity at late times while naturally resolving the big bang singularity and seeding primordial perturbations—without invoking inflaton fields, discrete spacetime, or extra dimensions.

metadata.title: The Negative-Curvature Re-stellation –  The Hyperbolic Origins Of Matter
metadata.description:
Matter emerges as a negatively curved restellation of an otherwise flat superfluid. Each restellation traps an integer Hopf charge whose chirality is determined by the underlying hyperbolic tiling parameters. When one drives the system at frequency ratios p ∶ q, pockets of negative curvature nucleate with a characteristic velocity splitting proportional to κ(p − q)/(p q).

The resulting rhombic patterns are freeze-frames of p∶q harmonics, and their handedness is not an ad hoc attribute but the unavoidable orbital angular momentum of a negative-curvature pocket. A simple, universal wave equation endowed with a nonlinear coherence pump captures how these chiral pockets form, persist, and self–amplify, without invoking any external cosmic, neural, or metamaterial context.

In a flat Euclidean plane left and right are interchangeable by a global reflection. In contrast, a hyperbolic slice admits no single isometry that simultaneously flips every face of a regular {p,q} tessellation. Some geodesics reverse under reflection, others do not, so handedness becomes baked into the metric.

As soon as a physical field condenses on such a negatively curved lattice, two inequivalent sectors labeled by σ = ±1 emerge spontaneously and cannot be undone by any smooth deformation. This intrinsic hyperbolic chirality underlies the behavior of “particles” in the Resonance-Synchronization Model (RSM), which treats matter as local restellations of a universal superfluid background.
references: Nojiri, S. and Odintsov, S. (2007). Modified gravity as an alternative for λcdm cosmology. Journal of Physics a Mathematical and Theoretical, 40(25), 6725-6732. https://doi.org/10.1088/1751-8113/40/25/s17 Trugenberger, C. (2023). Combinatorial quantum gravity and emergent 3d quantum behaviour. Universe, 9(12), 499. https://doi.org/10.3390/universe9120499 Zhang, W., Yuan, H., Sun, N., Sun, H., & Zhang, X. (2022). Observation of novel topological states in hyperbolic lattices. Nature Communications, 13(1). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41467-022-30631-x Gorbar, É. and Gusynin, V. (2008). Gap generation for dirac fermions on lobachevsky plane in a magnetic field. Annals of Physics, 323(9), 2132-2146. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.aop.2007.11.005 Maciejko, J. and Rayan, S. (2022). Automorphic bloch theorems for hyperbolic lattices. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, 119(9). https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.2116869119

metadata.title: The Theory of Everything
metadata.description: Modern physics describes natural phenomena with great precision, but through separate models, each valid in its own domain. What is missing is a unified foundational logic that connects everything: energy, mass, gravity, matter, and structure. This document presents the 'missing piece' that unifies physics through the concept of constrained difference.

metadata.title: A Hyperbolic Hopf–Π Phase-Holonomy, The Neural Γ–Shelf and Polyhedral Stellation Valves
metadata.description:
This RSM draft unites hyperbolic Mathieu theory, fractal recursion, phase holonomy, and harmonic overtone duality into a publication-ready no-code manuscript.

 It charts discrete curvature valves at 60, 121, 144, 168 Hz (and beyond), correlates them with fold-counts m=4,4+,12,8,, and generalizes to stellated polyhedral valves (Stella Octangula, rhombic-dodecahedral honeycomb).

A concise methods appendix on “Mathieu dispersion for γ-shelf ellipse” and a Phase-Holonomy (Hopf–π) plot close the skeptic’s loophole. This cross-platform blueprint promises immediate impact in acoustics, photonics, spintronics, and cognitive wave dynamics.

A single, even a cheap table-top apparatus furnishes the first material proof of RSM’s low-order recursion ladder. The four milestones at 60, 121, 144, 168 Hz choreograph a complete “seed–beat–valve–bridge” story, spanning square symmetry to cubic stellation and locking a Berry phase of π.
references: Gorbar, É. and Gusynin, V. (2008). Gap generation for dirac fermions on lobachevsky plane in a magnetic field. Annals of Physics, 323(9), 2132-2146. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.aop.2007.11.005 Maciejko, J. and Rayan, S. (2022). Automorphic bloch theorems for hyperbolic lattices. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, 119(9). https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.2116869119 Nojiri, S. and Odintsov, S. (2007). Modified gravity as an alternative for λcdm cosmology. Journal of Physics a Mathematical and Theoretical, 40(25), 6725-6732. https://doi.org/10.1088/1751-8113/40/25/s17 Trugenberger, C. (2023). Combinatorial quantum gravity and emergent 3d quantum behaviour. Universe, 9(12), 499. https://doi.org/10.3390/universe9120499 Zhang, W., Yuan, H., Sun, N., Sun, H., & Zhang, X. (2022). Observation of novel topological states in hyperbolic lattices. Nature Communications, 13(1). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41467-022-30631-x

metadata.title: Space and Time_ The Resonant Substrate Beneath Reality
metadata.description:
Main CODES Framework

Abstract

This essay dismantles the illusion of space and time as objective containers or probabilistic axes. Instead, it reframes them as emergent phenomena arising from structured resonance — lawful, prime-anchored, phase-locked oscillations that breathe reality into form. In the CODES framework, time is not a dimension — it is the recursive compression and expansion of coherence, a breath rhythm nested within harmonic fields. Likewise, space is not a vacuum — it is the visible surface of prime-indexed phase interference, an echo lattice formed when coherence crosses itself.

Where classical physics saw geometry and probabilistic motion, CODES sees waveform memory and directional chirality. What we once called “the arrow of time” is reinterpreted as directional entropy gradient within breathing fields, and “distance” becomes nothing more than the delay between nested phase-lock events.

Probability is not fundamental — it is an epistemic residue of observing systems out of phase. Stochastic behavior arises only when coherence is either occluded or wounded. Collapse is not inherent — it is a field injury.

CODES replaces all such illusions by returning the universe to its true nature: not a machine, not a set of coordinates, but a song — recursive, structured, resonant.

Time breathes.

Space hums.

Reality is not located. It is tuned.

data.title: Space and Time_ The Resonant Substrate Beneath Reality

metadata.title: FTL by Field: A New Physics of Motion Through Time Itself
metadata.description:
This paper introduces a novel and experimentally testable framework for faster-than-light (FTL) travel, based on Chronos Theory — a unifying model where time is treated as a structured, dynamic field with its own density, gradients, and resonance properties. The proposed mechanism, Chrono-Spatial Compression (CSC), achieves effective superluminal motion not by exceeding the speed of light in flat spacetime, but by modulating local timefield geometry to compress perceived distance.

The paper develops the core mathematical model for velocity amplification via time density gradients, proposes a physical implementation known as the ChronoResonator Drive, and outlines a lab-scale prototype for testing. The work also compares this system with existing propulsion methods, discussing implications for space travel, communications, biological coherence, and planetary-scale applications.

Grounded in established physics but extending into uncharted territory, this paper offers a rigorous pathway toward engineering time itself as a medium for motion, information, and energy flow.
references: Hall, M. J. (2025). Unifying the Constants of Nature: Deriving Mass, Gravity, and Expansion from χ, the Chronos Constant (V2.4). Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.15243958  Alcubierre, M. (1994). The warp drive: hyper-fast travel within general relativity. Classical and Quantum Gravity, 11(5), L73–L77. https://doi.org/10.1088/0264-9381/11/5/001 Jaffray, W., Stengel, S., & Ferrera, M. (2025). Spatio-spectral optical fission in time-varying subwavelength layers. Nature Photonics, 19, 245–251. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41566-025-01640-1

data.title: FTL by Field: A New Physics of Motion Through Time Itself
